trans-unit.source: Create a volume
trans-unit.target: Create a volume

trans-unit.source: Explains how to add a volume on a StorSimple device.
trans-unit.target: Explains how to add a volume on a StorSimple device.

trans-unit.source: To create a volume
trans-unit.target: To create a volume

trans-unit.source: On the device Quick Start page, click Add a volume.
trans-unit.target: On the device Quick Start page, click Add a volume.

trans-unit.source: This starts the Add a volume wizard.
trans-unit.target: This starts the Add a volume wizard.

trans-unit.source: In the Add a volume wizard, under Basic Settings:
trans-unit.target: In the Add a volume wizard, under Basic Settings:

trans-unit.source: Type a Name for your volume.
trans-unit.target: Type a Name for your volume.

trans-unit.source: Specify the Provisioned Capacity for your volume.
trans-unit.target: Specify the Provisioned Capacity for your volume.

trans-unit.source: The volume capacity must be between 1 GB and 64 TB.
trans-unit.target: The volume capacity must be between 1 GB and 64 TB.

trans-unit.source: On the drop-down list, select the Usage Type for your volume.
trans-unit.target: On the drop-down list, select the Usage Type for your volume.

trans-unit.source: For less frequently accessed archival data, select an Archive volume.
trans-unit.target: For less frequently accessed archival data, select an Archive volume.

trans-unit.source: For all other types of data, select Tiered Volume.
trans-unit.target: For all other types of data, select Tiered Volume.

trans-unit.source: (Tiered volumes were formerly called primary volumes).
trans-unit.target: (Tiered volumes were formerly called primary volumes).

trans-unit.source: Click the arrow icon <linkText>arrow-icon</linkText> to go to the next page.
trans-unit.target: Click the arrow icon <linkText>arrow-icon</linkText> to go to the next page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add volume</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add volume</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Additional Settings dialog box, add a new access control record (ACR):
trans-unit.target: In the Additional Settings dialog box, add a new access control record (ACR):

trans-unit.source: Supply a Name for your ACR.
trans-unit.target: Supply a Name for your ACR.

trans-unit.source: Under iSCSI Initiator Name, provide the iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN) of your Windows host.
trans-unit.target: Under iSCSI Initiator Name, provide the iSCSI Qualified Name (IQN) of your Windows host.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have the IQN, go to <link><linkText>Get the IQN of a Windows Server host</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have the IQN, go to <link><linkText>Get the IQN of a Windows Server host</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Under Default backup for this volume?, select the Enable check box.
trans-unit.target: Under Default backup for this volume?, select the Enable check box.

trans-unit.source: The default backup will create a policy that executes at 22:30 each day (device time) and creates a cloud snapshot of this volume.
trans-unit.target: The default backup will create a policy that executes at 22:30 each day (device time) and creates a cloud snapshot of this volume.

trans-unit.source: After the backup is enabled here, it cannot be reverted.
trans-unit.target: After the backup is enabled here, it cannot be reverted.

trans-unit.source: You will need to edit the volume to modify this setting.
trans-unit.target: You will need to edit the volume to modify this setting.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add volume</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add volume</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click the check icon <linkText>check icon</linkText>.
trans-unit.target: Click the check icon <linkText>check icon</linkText>.

trans-unit.source: A volume will be created with the specified settings.
trans-unit.target: A volume will be created with the specified settings.
